reg_pit.acttitle: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act
reg_pit.title: Minister of State for Child Care Expected Results for the 2019/2020 Fiscal Year Regulation

change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 29/2022, effective February 15, 2022.

reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Minister of State for Child Care Expected Results for the 2019/2020 Fiscal Year Regulation

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation applies to the Minister of State for Child Care for the 2019/2020 fiscal year.
In this regulation, Act means the Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister of State for Child Care
bcl:section.bcl:text: The expected results that the Minister of State for Child Care is to achieve for the purposes of section 5 (3) of the Act are as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: continue implementation of initiatives that support government's universal child care plan that provides affordable, accessible and high-quality care and early learning for every child whose family wants or needs it;
monitor and report publicly on results achieved through the implementation of B.C.'s actions under the Multilateral Early Learning and Child Care Framework agreement with the federal government;
continue engagement with all levels of government, child care providers and the private and not-for-profit sectors to further inform implementation of the plan for universal child care;
submit to Cabinet a report on the results referred to in paragraphs (a) through (c) on or before March 31, 2020.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability Act, S.B.C. 2001, c. 28, section 9]
